conclusion: Calculate induced EMF using area and angular velocity, then determine induced current based on resistance and EMF.
Rectangular wire frame abcd rotates in a uniform horizontal magnetic field with a fixed vertical axis along cd. Magnetic induction intensity is B, area is S, resistance is R.
Area of the wire frame is S, rotates at angular velocity ω.
Induced EMF is given by EMF = SωB.
When frame rotates through 60°, EMF becomes EMF = SωB * (60/360) = (1/6)SωB.
Instantaneous induced current i is given by i = EMF/R = (1/6)(SωB)/R.
Average induced EMF over 60° rotation is (1/6)SωB.
Average induced current i_avg is given by i_avg = EMF_avg/R = (1/6)(SωB)/R.
Instantaneous value of induced current is (1/6)(SωB)/R. Average value of induced EMF is (1/6)SωB. Average value of induced current is (1/6)(SωB)/R.
